verses.text: My son Orson, hearken and hear and behold what I, the Lord God, shall say unto you, even Jesus Christ your Redeemer;

similars.text: Hearken, O ye Gentiles, and hear the words of Jesus Christ, the Son of the living God, which he hath commanded me that I should speak concerning you, for, behold he commandeth me that I should write, saying:
Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.
Behold, thou art one in me, a son of God; and thus may all become my sons. Amen.

And now, O my son, ye are called of God to preach the word unto this people. And now, my son, go thy way, declare the word with truth and soberness, that thou mayest bring souls unto repentance, that the great plan of mercy may have claim upon them. And may God grant unto you even according to my words. Amen.
And I say unto thee, Let my son go, that he may serve me: and if thou refuse to let him go, behold, I will slay thy son, even thy firstborn.
The Lord thy God will raise up unto thee a Prophet from the midst of thee, of thy brethren, like unto me; unto him ye shall hearken;
But, behold, my Beloved Son, which was my Beloved and Chosen from the beginning, said unto me--Father, thy will be done, and the glory be thine forever.
Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

Behold I say unto you, that whosoever has heard the words of the prophets, yea, all the holy prophets who have prophesied concerning the coming of the Lord--I say unto you, that all those who have hearkened unto their words, and believed that the Lord would redeem his people, and have looked forward to that day for a remission of their sins, I say unto you, that these are his seed, or they are the heirs of the kingdom of God.

verses.text: The light and the life of the world, a light which shineth in darkness and the darkness comprehendeth it not;

similars.text: And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.
Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.
Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.
Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
He is the light and the life of the world; yea, a light that is endless, that can never be darkened; yea, and also a life which is endless, that there can be no more death.
And it shall come to pass in that day, that the light shall not be clear, nor dark:
Shall not the day of the Lord be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?
A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
In him was life; and the life was the light of men.
He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.

verses.text: Who so loved the world that he gave his own life, that as many as would believe might become the sons of God. Wherefore you are my son;

similars.text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

Wherefore, my beloved brethren, pray unto the Father with all the energy of heart, that ye may be filled with this love, which he hath bestowed upon all who are true followers of his Son, Jesus Christ; that ye may become the sons of God; that when he shall appear we shall be like him, for we shall see him as he is; that we may have this hope; that we may be purified even as he is pure. Amen.
Who against hope believed in hope, that he might become the father of many nations, according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be.
For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.
If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.
David therefore himself calleth him Lord; and whence is he then his son? And the common people heard him gladly.
Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.
Wherefore, the Lord God gave unto man that he should act for himself. Wherefore, man could not act for himself save it should be that he was enticed by the one or the other.
The Son of man indeed goeth, as it is written of him: but woe to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man if he had never been born.
But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, even to them that believe on his name:

verses.text: And blessed are you because you have believed;

similars.text: And again, more blessed are they who shall believe in your words because that ye shall testify that ye have seen me, and that ye know that I am. Yea, blessed are they who shall believe in your words, and come down into the depths of humility and be baptized, for they shall be visited with fire and with the Holy Ghost, and shall receive a remission of their sins.
Even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:

And now my beloved brethren, do you believe these things? Behold, I say unto you, yea, I know that ye believe them; and the way that I know that ye believe them is by the manifestation of the Spirit which is in me. And now because your faith is strong concerning that, yea, concerning the things which I have spoken, great is my joy.
By which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain.
For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.
Jesus saith unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.
I have declared, and have saved, and I have shewed, when there was no strange god among you: therefore ye are my witnesses, saith the Lord, that I am God.
And Jesus answering saith unto them, Have faith in God.
And he said: Yea, I believe according to thy words.

And now, because of their steadfastness when they do believe in that thing which they do believe, for because of their firmness when they are once enlightened, behold, the Lord shall bless them and prolong their days, notwithstanding their iniquity--

verses.text: And more blessed are you because you are called of me to preach my gospel--

similars.text: Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;

Verily I say unto you, that ye are built upon my gospel; therefore ye shall call whatsoever things ye do call, in my name; therefore if ye call upon the Father, for the church, if it be in my name the Father will hear you;
So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.
And he said unto them, I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also: for therefore am I sent.
But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.
Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?

Verily, verily, I say unto you, this is my gospel; and ye know the things that ye must do in my church; for the works which ye have seen me do that shall ye also do; for that which ye have seen me do even that shall ye do;
That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.

And now, O my son, ye are called of God to preach the word unto this people. And now, my son, go thy way, declare the word with truth and soberness, that thou mayest bring souls unto repentance, that the great plan of mercy may have claim upon them. And may God grant unto you even according to my words. Amen.
Behold I have given unto you my gospel, and this is the gospel which I have given unto you--that I came into the world to do the will of my Father, because my Father sent me.

verses.text: To lift up your voice as with the sound of a trump, both long and loud, and cry repentance unto a crooked and perverse generation, preparing the way of the Lord for his second coming.

similars.text: For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:
O that I were an angel, and could have the wish of mine heart, that I might go forth and speak with the trump of God, with a voice to shake the earth, and cry repentance unto every people!
Cry aloud, spare not, lift up thy voice like a trumpet, and shew my people their transgression, and the house of Jacob their sins.
Therefore now amend your ways and your doings, and obey the voice of the Lord your God; and the Lord will repent him of the evil that he hath pronounced against you.
They shall lift up their voice, they shall sing for the majesty of the Lord, they shall cry aloud from the sea.
But behold, the voice of the Lord came unto him, that he should return again, and prophesy unto the people whatsoever things should come into his heart.

And the Lord shall cause his glorious voice to be heard, and shall shew the lighting down of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and with the flame of a devouring fire, with scattering, and tempest, and hailstones.
Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle.
Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

So it shall be a reproach and a taunt, an instruction and an astonishment unto the nations that are round about thee, when I shall execute judgments in thee in anger and in fury and in furious rebukes. I the Lord have spoken it.

verses.text: For behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, the time is soon at hand that I shall come in a cloud with power and great glory.

similars.text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
Behold, the Lord hath shown unto me great and marvelous things concerning that which must shortly come, at that day when these things shall come forth among you.
Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, I will declare unto you my doctrine.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live.
And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, when these things shall be made known unto them of the Father, and shall come forth of the Father, from them unto you;
And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my Lord be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,
And he said unto me: Awake, and hear the words which I shall tell thee; for behold, I am come to declare unto you the glad tidings of great joy.
Behold, it is come, and it is done, saith the Lord God; this is the day whereof I have spoken.

Lift up your head and be of good cheer; for behold, the time is at hand, and on this night shall the sign be given, and on the morrow come I into the world, to show unto the world that I will fulfil all that which I have caused to be spoken by the mouth of my holy prophets.

verses.text: And it shall be a great day at the time of my coming, for all nations shall tremble.

similars.text: Behold, the Lord hath shown unto me great and marvelous things concerning that which must shortly come, at that day when these things shall come forth among you.
For in my jealousy and in the fire of my wrath have I spoken, Surely in that day there shall be a great shaking in the land of Israel;
For the great day of his wrath is come; and who shall be able to stand?
And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:
And many nations shall be joined to the Lord in that day, and shall be my people: and I will dwell in the midst of thee, and thou shalt know that the Lord of hosts hath sent me unto thee.
And I will shake all nations, and the desire of all nations shall come: and I will fill this house with glory, saith the Lord of hosts.
And now I say unto you that the time shall come that the salvation of the Lord shall be declared to every nation, kindred, tongue, and people.

And it shall be to me a name of joy, a praise and an honour before all the nations of the earth, which shall hear all the good that I do unto them: and they shall fear and tremble for all the goodness and for all the prosperity that I procure unto it.

And when that day shall come they shall be visited of the Lord of Hosts, with thunder and with earthquake, and with a great noise, and with storm, and with tempest, and with the flame of devouring fire.
And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy:

verses.text: But before that great day shall come, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon be turned into blood; and the stars shall refuse their shining, and some shall fall, and great destructions await the wicked.

similars.text: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and the terrible day of the Lord come.
The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before that great and notable day of the Lord come:
The sun and the moon shall be darkened, and the stars shall withdraw their shining.
The earth shall quake before them; the heavens shall tremble: the sun and the moon shall be dark, and the stars shall withdraw their shining:
Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:
And immediately after the tribulation of those days, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of heaven shall be shaken.

And the day shall come that the earth shall rest, but before that day the heavens shall be darkened, and a veil of darkness shall cover the earth; and the heavens shall shake, and also the earth; and great tribulations shall be among the children of men, but my people will I preserve;

But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.
But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,
And when I shall put thee out, I will cover the heaven, and make the stars thereof dark; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon shall not give her light.

verses.text: Wherefore, lift up your voice and spare not, for the Lord God hath spoken; therefore prophesy, and it shall be given by the power of the Holy Ghost.

similars.text: Angels speak by the power of the Holy Ghost; wherefore, they speak the words of Christ. Wherefore, I said unto you, feast upon the words of Christ; for behold, the words of Christ will tell you all things what ye should do.
Wherefore (as the Holy Ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his voice,
Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.

For those who shall be destroyed shall speak unto them out of the ground, and their speech shall be low out of the dust, and their voice shall be as one that hath a familiar spirit; for the Lord God will give unto him power, that he may whisper concerning them, even as it were out of the ground; and their speech shall whisper out of the dust.

But when they shall lead you, and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.

But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.
Yea, wo be unto him that hearkeneth unto the precepts of men, and denieth the power of God, and the gift of the Holy Ghost!
And all these blessings shall come on thee, and overtake thee, if thou shalt hearken unto the voice of the Lord thy God.
Cursed is he that putteth his trust in man, or maketh flesh his arm, or shall hearken unto the precepts of men, save their precepts shall be given by the power of the Holy Ghost.
And the Holy Ghost giveth authority that I should speak these things, and deny them not.

verses.text: And if you are faithful, behold, I am with you until I come--

similars.text: Now I tell you before it come, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I am he.
As for me, behold, I am in your hand: do with me as seemeth good and meet unto you.
For though I be absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, joying and beholding your order, and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.
Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.
Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.
I will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness: and thou shalt know the Lord.
Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.
But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.
And I will walk among you, and will be your God, and ye shall be my people.
For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

verses.text: And verily, verily, I say unto you, I come quickly. I am your Lord and your Redeemer. Even so. Amen.

similars.text: He which testifieth these things saith, Surely I come quickly. Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus.
Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, I will declare unto you my doctrine.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.
Therefore, my brethren dearly beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, my dearly beloved.
Let thy mercies come also unto me, O Lord, even thy salvation, according to thy word.

Yea, verily I say unto you, if ye will come unto me ye shall have eternal life. Behold, mine arm of mercy is extended towards you, and whosoever will come, him will I receive; and blessed are those who come unto me.
Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.
For behold, as yet, ye have been obedient unto the word of the Lord, which I have given unto you.
Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;
And now, my brethren, I would speak unto you more; but on the morrow I will declare unto you the remainder of my words. Amen.
